channel.title: knuth on The Quiescent Current
channel.description: Recent content in knuth on The Quiescent Current

item.title: The Itanium Flop
item.description:
I wake up in the morning with ideas that please me, and some of those ideas actually please me also later in the day when I’ve entered them into my computer. - Donald Knuth

I’m on a bit of a Knuth kick right now, and I’ve been procrastinating studying, and homework to find interviews, and papers by the master himself. I currently have a list of microfiche references to check out as soon as I get to the basement of my university’s library: Woot, computational necromancy! Through this, I came across a quote in an interview, “…worse than the “Itanium” approach that was supposed to be so terrific—until it turned out that the wished-for compilers were basically impossible to write.” What? I thought it was simply market forces that drive the x86-64 ahead of Itanium: nope!
